title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 20, 2019).

Gantz declared victory in Israel's election and rebuffed Netanyahu's calls for power sharing, as the country braced for weeks of political uncertainty amid rising tensions in the Mideast.

Iran's top diplomat said that a military strike by the U.S. or Saudi Arabia against his country would result in "an all-out war."

The Pentagon is considering sending additional assets to the Mideast.

A whistleblower complaint that prompted a standoff between the U.S. intelligence community and Democrats in Congress involves Trump's communications with a foreign leader.

Canada's Trudeau tried to contain a growing firestorm after a series of images emerged of him wearing blackface and brownface.

The number of cases of vaping-associated pulmonary illness continues to rise, and a federal official disclosed that a criminal probe is under way.

Zuckerberg met with Trump during a Washington visit in which the Facebook chief received a chilly reception from lawmakers.

The House passed a short-term spending bill, taking the first step toward avoiding a government shutdown at the end of the month.

The president filed a lawsuit to block a subpoena from New York prosecutors for his tax returns.

Died: Zine El Abidine Ben Ali, 83, ruled Tunisia for over two decades.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 20, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
